intro: Scilla carunculifera var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular scilla, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous root system. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, forming a rosette at the base. This variety is distinguished by the presence of glandular structures on its leaves and stems, which contribute to its unique botanical identity.
